com.github.lwhite1.tablesaw.store

Class StorageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.lwhite1.tablesaw.store.StorageManager

  • public class StorageManager
extends Object
    A controller for reading and writing data in Tablesaw's own compressed, column-oriented file format

      • readTable

        public static Table readTable(String path)
                       throws IOException
        Reads a tablesaw table into memory
        Parameters:
        path - The location of the table. It is interpreted as relative to the working directory if not fully specified. The path will typically end in ".saw", as in "mytables/nasdaq-2015.saw"
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file cannot be read

      • saveTable

        public static String saveTable(String folderName,
                               Relation table)
                        throws IOException
        Saves the data from the given table in the location specified by folderName. Within that folder each table has its own sub-folder, whose name is based on the name of the table.

        NOTE: If you store a table with the same name in the same folder. The data in that folder will be over-written.

        The storage format is the tablesaw compressed column-oriented format, which consists of a set of file in a folder. The name of the folder is based on the name of the table.

        Parameters:
        folderName - The location of the table (for example: "mytables")
        table - The table to be saved
        Returns:
        The path and name of the table
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeColumn

        public static void writeColumn(String fileName,
                               CategoryColumn column)
                        throws IOException
        Writes out the values of the category column encoded as ints to minimize the time required for subsequent reads The files are written Strings first, then the ints that encode them so they can be read in the opposite order
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeTableMetadata

        public static void writeTableMetadata(String fileName,
                                      Relation table)

        Writes out a json-formatted representation of the given table's metadata to the given file
        Parameters:
        fileName - Expected to be fully specified
        Throws:

      • readTableMetadata

        public static TableMetadata readTableMetadata(String fileName)
                                       throws IOException
        Reads in a json-formatted file and creates a TableMetadata instance from it. Files are expected to be in the format provided by TableMetadata}
        Parameters:
        fileName - Expected to be fully specified
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file can not be read
